definition: Barkhor street, central business area and pilgrim circuit around Jokhang temple in Lhasa, Tibet
eight/8
big/empty/open
street/CL:條|条[tiao2]

sentences.english: Pilgrims walking around on Barkhor Street.
sentences.chinese: 每天都有許多人在八廓街上轉經。

sentences.english: Among them, " Barkhor street" is the most prestigious one.
sentences.chinese: 其中，“八廓街”在國內外享有盛譽。

sentences.english: We walk one last time the barkhor and shop for the last souvenirs.
sentences.chinese: 我們最後一次來到八廓街，準備買些紀念品。

definition: Barkhor street, central business area and pilgrim circuit around Jokhang temple in Lhasa, Tibet/same as 八廓街[Ba1 kuo4 Jie1]
Jokhang, main Buddhist temple in Lhasa, a sacred place of Tibetan Buddhism

Drepung monastery, Lhasa, Tibet

Norbulingka (Tibetan: precious garden), summer residence of Dalai Lamas in Lhasa, Tibet
Ganden monastery, Tibetan: dGa' ldan rNam rgyal gling, Dagzê county 達孜縣|达孜县[Da2 zi1 xian4], Lhasa, Tibet
Kumbum (Chinese Ta'er), monastery in Qinhai, formerly Amdo province of Tibet
Namtso or Lake Nam (officially Nam Co), mountain lake at Nakchu in central Tibet
Lhagang temple in Dartsendo county 康定縣|康定县[Kang1 ding4 xian4], Garze Tibetan autonomous prefecture, Sichuan
